title: How do I get my Pixel 4a 5G to use my cochlear implants instead of the speaker?
content:
In "Settings | Connected Devices" I can see both of the processors for my cochlear implants listed.   However, I am unable to get my Pixel 4A 5G to send any sound to my processors - it insists on using the phone's speaker.

In "Settings | Accessibility | Hearing Aids" it says "No hearing aids connected" ... and it provides no way for me to select my processors that are already listed in "Settings|Connected Devices".    Part of the problem is perhaps that I don't have hearing aids, I have cochlear implants and the phone does not know how to deal with cochlear implants?   My processors are "Nucleus 7" made by Cochlear.

I would like to permanently turn off the speaker on the phone and have ALL sounds go to my processors.
